TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SignatureLine extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a Signature Line control in a view.

remarks.para: This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

The class provides programmatic access to a Signature Line control in a view. To access an instance of the class associated with a Signature Line control, use the that is associated with the view that contains the control. The following code example shows how to access a object that represents the first control in the current view.

Only a subset of the properties of the Signature Line control are exposed through the class and its associated members of the object model. For example, the properties for specifying the size and tab index of the control can be set only by using the InfoPath designer. However, properties, such as the , , and properties, can be used to get or set the name, title, and e-mail address of the suggested signer for the control. Use the property to return a object associated with the control, which you can then use to access the digital signature associated with the control. The method can be used to programmatically display the Sign dialog box to initiate signing.

public abstract string Id { get; }
.property instance string Id
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Id As String

member this.Id : string

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the control ID property.

remarks.para: The value of the ID property is set by InfoPath when the Signature Line control is added to the form template. To display this value in the InfoPath designer, right-click the control, click Signature Control Properties, and then click the Advanced tab.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool Sign (string imageUrl, string suggestedSigner, string suggestedSignerTitle, string suggestedSignerEmail);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Sign(string imageUrl, string suggestedSigner, string suggestedSignerTitle, string suggestedSignerEmail) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function Sign (imageUrl As String, suggestedSigner As String, suggestedSignerTitle As String, suggestedSignerEmail As String) As Boolean
public: abstract bool Sign(System::String ^ imageUrl, System::String ^ suggestedSigner, System::String ^ suggestedSignerTitle, System::String ^ suggestedSignerEmail);
abstract member Sign : string * string * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The path to the signature or stamp image to display in the control.
The name of the suggested signer.
The title of the suggested signer.
The e-mail address of the suggested signer.
Docs.summary: Displays the Sign dialog box with the specified signature image or stamp, and the suggested signer name, title, and e-mail address.
Docs.returns: true if the signing operation succeeds; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The values for all of the parameters of the method are optional. To omit any parameter, pass a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for that parameter. You can also pass String.Empty for the , , and parameters. If you pass a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or String.Empty for a parameter and the value of the corresponding property was previously set programmatically or in the Signature Line control at design time, that value will be used when the form or set of data is signed.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: The following code example accesses the first Signature Line control in the current view, and then calls the method to display the Sign dialog box for signing the entire form or set of data associated with the control. After the control is signed, the code displays a message box that shows the value of the property for the control.
example.code: Dim mySignatureLine As SignatureLine = _ Me.CurrentView.SignatureLines(0) mySignatureLine.Sign("C:\Users\Larry\Pictures\MySignature.jpg", _ "Larry Zhang", "Sales Associate", "larry@contoso.com") MessageBox.Show(mySignatureLine.SignatureAppearanceType.ToString())

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the e-mail address of the suggested signer for the control.
Docs.value: The e-mail address of the suggested signer.

remarks.para: Whether it is set at design time or programmatically, the value of the property is not displayed in the user interface of the Signature Line control. It is stored as metadata when the form or set of data is signed, and can be accessed programmatically from form code by using this property.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
